column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I wound up in Cy Twombley's room looking out the window of one of Renzo Piano's gorgeous buildings at Frank Gehry's amphitheater.  That is the best room in the whole entire museum.  How did I go from Rauschenberg to Twombley with Piano?  You'd have had to visit the Menil in Houston
column2: then it makes absolute sense.  Anyway
column3: it's just a gorgeous room to spend time.  Clean lines made from natural and industrial materials
column4: but not harsh.  Soft.  Modern and classical.  Beyond Gehry's amphitheater is Gehry's bridge.  If you ever
column6: I highly recommend going to these three places.  Piano's modern wing
column7: then Gehry's two structures outside.  Right
column8: I'll pull myself back into the museum.
